anime.description: An original series that`s part of the Ultra Super Anime Time, Kagewani is being directed by Tomoya Takashima and written by Hiromu Kumamoto, both of whom have had plenty of experience with creepy suspense anime shorts, having both worked on the Yamishibai: Japanese Ghost Stories series. The plot centers on mysterious monsters called "UMA" that suddenly appear and start attacking humans. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: horror
tag.description: The horror cinematic genre is characterized by the attempt to make the viewer experience dread, fear, terror, or horror. Often their plots involve the intrusion of an evil force, event or personage, sometimes of supernatural origin, on the mundane world and the consequences thereof.

tag.name: eating of humans
tag.description: The eating of humans, also called man-eating, is the practice of some species to prey on human beings for nourishment. Examples of possible hunters may include Earth animals, alien species, zombies or other undead, and so forth. Eating of humans is not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3815 [human cannibalism]; the former is about other species eating people, while the latter is about humans eating fellow humans.

tag.name: experimental animation
tag.description: This anime uses distinct, alternative animation — much unlike other contemporary anime — either throughout or in individual episodes/sequences.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: Ultra Super Anime Time
tag.description: Ultra Super Anime Time was a half-hour anime block produced by http://anidb.net/cr30397 [Ultra Super Pictures] that aired on Tokyo MX and BS11 between July 2015 and June 2016. The block typically featured three http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes] anime of about eight minutes each.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 試練
Trial
Yargılama
Shiren
episode.summary: Banba is brought to meet an old friend: Kimura, who supposedly died during the explosion at Sarugaku. Banba is made an offer he can`t refuse, but he has an ace up his sleeve: the power of the Kagewani. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘儀
Secret Ceremony
Gizli Ayin
Higi
episode.summary: A man travels with his girlfriend to an isolated hot springs. When his girlfriend disappears, the owners of the inn insist she was never here. But she actually is going to be sacrificed to a monster! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追行
Pursuit
Takip
Tsuikou
episode.summary: Banba is being transported on a train that`s attacked by one of the kagewani. The monster spits acid and devours people. Can he stop it before the train plunges off a cliff? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 胎動
Quickening
Hızlandırma
Taidou
episode.summary: A freelance writer hears a rumor that a plane landed with no passengers. He goes inside and finds a lone surviving stewardess, then he finds she`s not alone at all... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 記憶
Memories
Anılar
Kioku
episode.summary: Dr. Banba is absorbed by the memories of the Kagewani, and the terrifying, sorrowful past of the man trapped within it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 孤独
Isolation
Soyutlanma
Kodoku
episode.summary: A woman is sent alone into the snowy mountains. Her mission: to find and recover a human/Kagewani hybrid. But the arrival of another beast throws a wrench into her plans... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 失明
Blindness
Aymazlık
Shitsumei
episode.summary: One of the kagewani beasts appears at a shopping mall where a scientist is shopping with his blind daughter. His daughter is trapped inside: will he be able to rescue her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 衝突
Collision
Çarpışma
Shoutotsu
episode.summary: Dr. Banba is attacked by a ninja with a powerful anti-Kagewani weapon. Alone and stranded on a roof, he is helpless against her. But a familiar face arrives out of nowhere and intervenes- Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終局
The Final Battle
Son Savaş
Shuukyoku
episode.summary: Kimura has betrayed Banba and assumed the full power of the kagewani. There is nothing left to stop him from using it to slaughter every living creature in the world. But Nagi still has one last trick up her sleeve... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦
The Final Battle
Son Savaş
Kessen
episode.summary: The final battle for the Kagewani draws to an end, but a hidden enemy reveals himself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進化
Evolution
Evrim
Shinka
episode.summary: Banba tracks the Kagewani to its lair, only to discover a horrifying truth: the Kagewani has evolved. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢魔
Dream Demon
Rüya İfriti
Muma
episode.summary: Banba decides that the girl from the Yaguru clan his only clue to the kagewani. He sets a trap to lure her out, but will she survive the kagewani`s attacks long enough to fall for it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 餌食
Feed
Besin
Ejiki
episode.summary: Director Honma uses Banba as a method to control the Kagewani beasts and sell their powers to armies all around the world. When his presentation goes drastically wrong, Kimura leaves him to die. But can Banba escape? Source: crunchyroll
